About Workbench and SCIRun

SCIRun Interface

SCIRun is divided into three frames. The NetEdit frame is the large field located on the bottom of the screen where networks of modules are constructed. Since the NetEdit frame can grow to exceed the bounds of viewable area, the GlobalView frame in the top left corner shows which part of the NetEdit frame is currently being viewed. The Error frame in the top right corner will report any errors detected during startup.

Each network is made up of a series of modules--each representing a separate plant process or unit. For a detailed description of each module's function see the REI and Vision 21 Module Index .

For more detailed documentation about SCIRun see the Scientific Computing and Imaging Institute's Tutorial.

Basic Module Overview

Module Components

Inlet/Outlet Ports: These ports allow data to flow in and out of modules. Those located on the top of a module are inlet ports, those on the bottom represent outlet ports.

Port Connectors: These connect modules such that the outlet of one module becomes the inlet of a second. These connectors facilitate the continued flow of data through a module network. Grey connectors signify the flow of gases while blue connectors signify the flow of liquids.

Module Buttons: These buttons provide user-option menus to define module properties. The Graphical User Interface (UI) button prompts for details regarding module characteristics and desired outcomes. After a module has executed, the Summary Data (SUM) button displays calculated outcomes in tabular (spread sheet) format. The (XY), (3D), and (VE) buttons on select modules provide visual representations of module calculations.

Progress Bar: This bar shows the progress of calculations by turning green once a module has executed.

Data Log: This button pulls up a separate log window of warnings or errors. The button turns yellow when a warning was encountered during execution, whereas red signifies a critical error.

For more detailed documentation regarding module structure and utilization, see the Scientific Computing and Imaging Institute's Module Reference page.

Vision 21 Module Index

The REI Vision 21 Workbench offers a complete package of SCIRun-compatible modules. For a detailed description of each module's function and capabilities, see the Vision 21 Module Index.
